power.title: Always Falling Rage
power.fluff: The fury of the waterfall and the relentless push of water propels you past any defenses

section.name: Rage:
section.text: You enter Always Falling Rage.

section.name: Alternative:
section.text: You shift one-half your speed.

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. AC

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage, and you knock the target prone.

section.name: Miss:
section.text: Half damage.

power.section: When you do, you can shift up to one-half your speed instead of moving your speed as part of the charge. If you chose the alternative benefit, you can shift up to your speed.

section.text: Until the rage ends or you change to a different rage, you can use an opportunity reaction to shift 2 squares when an ally hits an enemy adjacent to you.

Additionally, on your turn you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls against targets that were further away from you at the start of your turn than when you make the attack, and you knock such targets prone on a critical hit.

power.title: Bloodhunt Rage
power.fluff: Your rage surges up from the depths of your pain to bring pain to the wounded

section.name: Rage:
section.text: You enter Bloodhunt Rage.

section.name: Alternative:
section.text: If you or the target is bloodied, you reroll any 1s on your damage roll for this power until the result is something other than a 1.

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. AC

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage.
If the target is bloodied, you deal additional damage equal to your Constitution modifier.

section.name: Miss:
section.text: Half damage.

Until the rage ends or you change to a different rage, you gain a bonus equal to your Constitution modifier to the damage rolls of melee and close attacks with the Weapon keyword if either you or the target is bloodied.
This stacks with the additional damage this power deals against a bloodied target.

power.title: Bloodseeker Drake Rage
power.fluff: As you strike, flashes of spectral teeth and blood-red scales reveal the bloodseeker drake's spirit that inspires your rage

section.name: Rage:
section.text: You enter Bloodseeker Drake Rage.

section.name: Alternative:
section.text: The attack roll bonus against a bloodied target is +4 instead of +2.

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. AC
You gain a +2 bonus to attack if the target is bloodied

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage.

section.name: Miss:
section.text: Half damage.
Until the rage ends or you change to a different rage, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls against bloodied targets.
In addition, you can use an immediate interrupt to make a barbarian at-will attack against a bloodied enemy that shifts or provokes a reactive strike.

power.title: Blood Bear Rage
power.fluff: You strike, then call on the spirit of the blood bear, drawing on its great strength and crushing grip to destroy your foes

section.name: Rage:
section.text: You enter Blood Bear Rage.

section.name: Alternative:
section.text: The target takes 5 + your Strength modifier damage at the start of its turn if it is still grabbed by you.

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. AC

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage.

section.name: Miss:
section.text: Half damage.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You grab the target and can maintain the grab with your weapon instead of a free hand if you wish.
Until the rage ends or you change to a different rage, you gain a +4 bonus to grab attack rolls and to checks and defenses against escape attempts.
Also, if an enemy starts its turn grabbed by you, it takes damage equal to 5 + your Strength modifier.

In addition, you can use an immediate interrupt to negate forced movement against a creature you are grabbing or against you when you are grabbing a creature. You cannot do this if both you and the creature you are grabbing are subject to the same forced movement.

power.title: Fearsome Tyrant Rage
power.fluff: Your blow is a prelude to a furious roar that turns your visage to that of unbridled berserker fury, causing your foes to recoil in terror

section.name: Rage:
section.text: You enter Fearsome Tyrant Rage.

section.name: Alternative:
section.text: You give each enemy adjacent to you a -2 penalty to attack rolls against you until the start of your next turn.

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. AC

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).

section.name: Miss:
section.text: Half damage, and the target is dazed until the end of its next turn.
Until the rage ends or you change to a different rage, you can use the Fearsome Tyrant Roar action once per turn.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You push the target 1 square, and it takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls against you until the start of your next turn.

power.title: Life Thane Rage
power.fluff: As you strike, raging energy boils out of you, healing you and invigorating your allies

section.name: Rage:
section.text: You enter Life Thane Rage.

section.name: Alternative:
section.text: You grant all allies within 3 squares of you temporary hit points equal to 3 + your Charisma modifier.

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. AC

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage.

section.name: Miss:
section.text: Half damage.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You can spend a healing surge to regain hit points equal to your healing surge value.
If you are bloodied, you regain additional hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.
Until the rage ends or you change to a different rage, you activate an Aura 3 (Primal).
Bloodied allies who start their turn in the aura gain temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.
In addition, you can use the Life Thane Recovery action.

section.name: Requirement:
section.text: You must be bloodied

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You spend a healing surge to regain hit points equal to your healing surge value.
Allies within the aura regain hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.

power.title: Macetail Behemoth Rage
power.fluff: You knock your enemy to the ground with a slam like the behemoth's heavy tail, and the rage of the macetail fills you, refreshing you with every blow of your weapon

section.name: Rage:
section.text: You enter Macetail Behemoth Rage.

section.name: Alternative:
section.text: You knock all targets prone even on a miss.

section.name: Attack:
section.target: each enemy in the burst you can see
section.text: Strength vs. Reflex

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 1[W] + Strength modifier damage, and you knock the target prone.

section.name: Miss:
section.text: Half damage.
Until the rage ends or you change to a different rage, when a barbarian attack allows you to push a target, you can halve the distance to knock the target prone.
In addition, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Strength modifier each time you hit with a barbarian attack power.
You gain an additional 5 temporary hit points if the target was already prone or was knocked prone by the attack.

power.title: Rage Drake Rage
power.fluff: You slam your weapon into your wounded foe, and the rage drake's spirit fills you, causing you to erupt in violence and swing furiously at a new foe as soon as the last one falters

section.name: Rage:
section.text: You enter Rage Drake Rage.

section.name: Alternative:
section.text: You make a melee basic attack against a different target after resolving this power.

section.name: Attack:
section.target: one creature, or two bloodied creatures
section.text: Strength vs. AC

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 2[W] + Strength modifier damage, or 3[W] + Strength modifier damage if you targeted only one bloodied creature.

section.name: Miss:
section.text: Half damage.

Until the rage ends or you change to a different rage, once per turn when you bloody or reduce an enemy to 0 hit points or less, you can make a melee basic attack against a different target as a free reaction.

power.title: Savage Juggernaut Rage
power.fluff: Your blow triggers an inner wrath that grows more and more unstoppable with each enemy you fell

section.name: Rage:
section.text: You enter Savage Juggernaut Rage.

section.name: Alternative:
section.text: You deal an additional +1[W] damage with this power.

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. AC

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage.

section.name: Miss:
section.text: Half damage.
Until the rage ends or you change to a different rage, you gain a +1 bonus to damage. This bonus increases by +1 for each enemy you reduce to 0 hit points or less.
In addition, you gain a +1 power bonus to attack rolls. This bonus increases by +1 for each nonminion enemy you reduce to 0 hit points or less.

power.title: Skulltaker Spirit Rage
power.fluff: The ancient berserker spirit that drives this rage doesn't care that its presence tears you apart, just as long as it can crush the skulls of your enemies as they hide behind their cowardly defenses

section.name: Rage:
section.text: You enter Skulltaker Spirit Rage.

section.name: Alternative:
section.text: You ignore any cover or concealment the target has for this attack

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. AC

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage.

section.name: Miss:
section.text: Half damage.

aspect.name: Skulltaker Spirit Rage

section.text: Until the rage ends or you change to a different rage, you take damage equal to your level at the start of each of your turns. This damage cannot be resisted or negated.

You are immune to being marked. If you start your turn suffering from a condition or effect that prevents you from taking actions or from making an attack against any creatures, you take damage equal to your level and end any such effects on you.
In addition, you gain a +2 bonus to all attack and damage rolls. You also ignore cover and concealment, including total concealment but not total cover, when using barbarian attack powers.

aspect.section: If you hit a creature with a barbarian attack, until the end of your next turn, that creature can not gain combat advantage against you for hiding or flanking, or for being invisible.

power.title: Stampeding Hooves Rage
power.fluff: You hammer your enemy with a heavy blow as the spirits of stampeding beasts fill you with their strength

section.name: Rage:
section.text: You enter Stampeding Hooves Rage.

section.name: Alternative:
section.text: You move one-half your speed, including through enemies' spaces. You gain a +4 bonus to attack rolls until the end of your turn against enemies whose space you moved through. If you used this attack when charging, you gain a +2 bonus to speed for the charge instead of moving one-half your speed.

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. AC

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage.

section.name: Miss:
section.text: Half damage.

power.section: When you do, you can choose to move through the target's space as part of the charge even though this does not bring you closer to the target.

section.text: Until the rage ends or you change to a different rage, you can move through your enemies' spaces, though the movement provokes reactive strikes normally. If you charge, you can choose to move through the target's space as part of the charge even though this does not bring you closer to the target.
In addition, you gain a +4 bonus to your first attack roll against enemies whose space you have moved through on the same turn.

power.title: Swift Panther Rage
power.fluff: You slash your foe with fury as the spirit of the swift panther grants you its speed and agility

section.name: Rage:
section.text: You enter Swift Panther Rage.

section.name: Alternative:
section.text: You shift 4 squares instead of 2 squares.

section.name: Effect:
section.text: You shift up to 2 squares.

section.name: Attack:
section.text: Strength vs. AC

section.name: Hit:
section.text: 3[W] + Strength modifier damage.

section.name: Miss:
section.text: Half damage.
Until the rage ends or you change to a different rage, you gain a +2 bonus to speed and can shift up to 2 squares as a move action.
In addition, when a barbarian power allows you to move or shift, you can move or shift 1 additional square. This stacks with the bonus to speed when a power allows you to move or shift your speed.
